result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrance O Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With credit for 1 day time served.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment".
NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.

Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
Cooperate with all Children's Court orders.
Parenting classes.
Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

timeConds.notes: STAYED pending a review on 2-12-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrance O Ward

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Terrance O Ward in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
CCAP is having printer issues so the JOC was sent over to DOC twice electronically.

Defendant Terrance O Ward in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  AS to count 1:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Counts 2 and 3 are ordered dismissed and read in.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by all parties.  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 36 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 1 day time served.  CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 24 MONTHS.  Conditions of probation include:
 -Serve 6 months days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 2-12-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Anger Management and continued programming.
-Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Cooperate with all Children's Court orders.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest for "domestic abuse or harassment".
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Terrance O Ward in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for Molly Schimidt for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to jury trial in progress and miscommunication between counsels as to today's date, the court will adjourn to 10-23-2015.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Terrance O Ward in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is requesting a new date as counsel is in trial.  State has no objection.  New plea/sentencing date of 10-20-2015.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Terrance O Ward in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for Plea & Sentencing. Case adjourned for plea and sentence before branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge KREMERS.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38.

Defendant Terrance O Ward in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense counsel requests a scheduling Conference. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Terrance O Ward in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Ronald Dague for Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Arraignment scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Per clerk in br.23, this preliminary hearing is to be set in Prelim Court  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 06-12-2015 at 01:30 pm.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (6/4/15). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with L.L.C.

Defendant Terrance O Ward in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/3/15 @ 1:30pm
